page.title: 14BIRDS OF THE BROADS
page.content: The most common bird of the broads is the Mallard.It has a glossy green head and a white collar.It feeds by dabbling and upending for food. MUTE SWAN-It is BritainÂ£s largest bird. It has a black knob at the top of itÂ£s orange bill.It hisses when angry and when it is flying the wings make a humming noise. GREY HERON-A large bird with a black eye stripe and head crest and a long yellow bill.The long neck may be outstretched when fishing,or hunched up when resting and flying.Uses its bill like a dagger to catch fish,birds or frogs.Builds itÂ£s nest on the top of a tree. Some of the other birds are Kingfishers,Marsh Harriers, Swallows and various other kinds of birds.
